ethnologue_comment.comment:
Tingui-Boto [tgv] is listed in E16/E17/E18/E19/E20/E21/E22/E23/E24/E25/E26 as an unclassified language of Brazil. There is certainly a corresponding ethnic group, but this group speaks Portuguese. They retain some of their ancestral language for ritual purposes, but this language is Dzubukuá (According to Vera Lúcia Calheiros Mata
<http://pib.socioambiental.org/pt/povo/tingui-boto/1050>
accessed 7 February 2012.). Dzubukuá
(**hh:g:deQueiroz:Dzubukua**) is subsumed under the (otherwise highly problematic) Kariri-Xoco [kzw] entry.


See also: Karirí-Xocó [kzw], South Ucayali Ashéninka [cpy].

meds: Dantas, Beatriz G. and José Augusto L. Sampaio and Maria Rosário G. de Carvalho 1998
